StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: PGRN-Leducq: Identification of the KCNE1 D85N polymorphism as a possible modulator of drug-induced Torsades de Pointes

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Samples and associated genotype and phenotype data used in this study were provided by Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Funding support was provided by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI), Grant 5U01 HL065962, and the Fondation Leducq.
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. The informed consent document signed by the study participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. These data may be used by only for genetic studies to learn about, prevent, or treat health problems.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.
The informed consent document signed by the study participants allows use of these data by investigators employed by non-profit and for-profit organizations. These data may be used by only for genetic studies to learn about, prevent, or treat health problems.

StudyTo.name: NHLBI Big Data Analysis Heart Failure Challenge Data Collection
